title: error creating env on Windows: dlc-windowsGPU.yaml: ResolvePackageNotFound:   - tensorflow-gpu==1.13.1
body:
**Operating system and DeepLabCut version:**

Windows 10, latest DeepLabCut, following these instructions: https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/installation.md
Anaconda env
GPU: GeoForce GTX 1080Ti
pip install tensorflow-gpu worked independent;y from DeepLabCut and recognizes the GPU

**Describe the problem:**
Error setting up environment for windows by using command 

> conda env create -f dlc-windowsGPU.yaml

With 'tensorflow-gpu' changed to 1.13.1:
tensorflow-gpu==1.13.1

Though when I do a 'conda list', I see this: (attached screenshot)
tensorflow-gpu            1.13.1                   pypi_0    pypi


**Steps to reproduce the behavior:**
1. Do pip install tensorflow-gpu (see attachment)
2. Run 'conda env create -f dlc-windowsGPU.yaml' from c:\Users\Usertytell_admin\Anaconda3\envs which contains the file dlc-windowsGPU.yaml
3. Error results: 
Collecting package metadata: done
Solving environment: failed

ResolvePackageNotFound:
  - tensorflow-gpu==1.13

**More details are in these screenshots:**
![Screenshot (3)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3596849/54058066-c3720080-41c2-11e9-8fe9-2bf8d8f9bf31.png)

![Screenshot (2)_LI](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3596849/54058076-cb31a500-41c2-11e9-94a7-2439f2d55e25.jpg)

**What happened earlier:**

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3596849/54058458-dd601300-41c3-11e9-947c-f63a635daded.png)

**Did a successful pip install tensorflow-gpu:**

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3596849/54058459-dd601300-41c3-11e9-91e7-a3b9985d2c29.png)
![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3596849/54058460-dd601300-41c3-11e9-95fb-64d3d7964cc6.png)
